name: Hotel Indigo Boston - Newton Riverside

reviews.text: The modern setting in the rooms is very nice. Problems: Desk chair doesn't fit under the desk. Housekeeping sloppy: e.g., one bed light not working, had to be replaced. Keurig coffee makes nice touch but coffee supplied was for one cup (i.e., one regular, one decaf, one tea) eventhou,gh room was booked for two; had to get more from the desk. Should not have had to do so! One elevator serves entire hotel and the below entrance level popular restuarant--so, a long wait for elevator at dinner hour, but had to use elevator to get to the only ice machine in the Hotel (on the sub-ground floor)
reviews.title: Lovely setting but unaddressed problems

reviews.text: For quality hotel prices, these design flaws and attention to detail about room readiness should not have been present. Prior to writing this review, communcated all issues to hotel chain, never got an answer other than (1) a response that my concenrs had been sent to hotel ,managemewnt and a response would be forthcoming with three business day. Two weeks later, still no response. Many hotels to choose from in reasonable proximity to this one; in my experience, the others provide quality control that was missing here..
reviews.title: Very Nice

reviews.text: The hotel was easily located off of the Highway and an easy walk to the riverside T station which is perfect for Red Sox fans. The beds were plushy covered with seemingly endless sheets. The room was clean, and the bathrooms were very fancy, including a chair to sit on, Nice flatscreens and relaxed, professional staff. Honored an early check in for 3 rooms( which seems unheard of now a days). The bar was excellent outdoor gazbos and fancy fireplaces. We went to the resturant very late(1055) after the Red Sox game and the Chef personally took the order and made sure it was cooked. (Excellent). I would recommend this hotel to everyone and anyone
reviews.title: not a family -oriented hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are very small, poor lighting for dressing and putting on makeup. the bed is very comfortable, there was always hot water in the shower. O n the DOWN side, the hotel's main focus is the bar and the clientele they cater to, young to mid aged singles on the prowl. You can only access the pool area after 8pm by making your way through the bar, which is jam packed. We did a lot of rushed sight seeing and were ready to just relax by the pool in the evenings, but, it's not a family environment at all. Men leered at my 14 yr old grandaughter each time she had to make her way through the bar to the poolside. Our main complaint was not addressed. Although the hotel has a dog friendly policy with rooms for them set aside, we were disturbed by a dog that had been allowed on a non dog floor, and was in the room next to us, he barked in the late night and in the early morning , the whole time his owner left him in the room. When we complained to the desk, it took 3 calls to learn that the dog was allowed because his owner was a friend of the manager. No compensation was offered for the inconvenience of being kept up all night. We had 8 rooms and were all pretty disappointed with our stay.
reviews.title: Cleaning service is terribly slow...

reviews.text: Cleaning service is terribly slow, elevators are sketchy and location is not so hot. Not an awful place, but I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Tv didn't work, needed burly security man...

reviews.text: This hotel was great. Staff was friendly and professional. Easy to access off the highway. Everything was immaculately clean. The rooms were slightly small, but we made it work. Beds were comfortable. The room was beautiful with hardwood floors and the bathroom was gorgeous with a glass enclosed shower. The elevators were slow, that is my only complaint!
reviews.title: Perfect spot for the perfect hotel

reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel numerous times over the last year and a half as it is convenient to Wellesley College. We booked two nights this past weekend and we now dub this establishment 'hotel hell'. While this place masquerades as a modern boutique hotel (no room service) with a popular, and rather good upscale restaurant on the lower level, the service is non-existent, the employees are disgruntled, and management is incompetent. The place is just run so poorly. At 1:08 am Saturday we had a loud group of at least a dozen people outside of our room; a fight broke out with running, people being thrown up against walls, screaming, etc. We opened our door after the police and ambulance arrived and, I kid you not, there was a good amount of blood smeared all over the walls next to our room and down the length of the hallway. Unfortunately after the sirens subsided the flashing lights made their way through the drapes. Hoping for a good night of sleep on Saturday we were awakened every half of an hour until 6 am by a drunken group of rowdy (cheering and yelling) post wedding partiers a few doors down. I am certain we were not the only guests calling the desk all night, but security began the eviction process a little after 5am as we regrettably heard every word of that discourse until it ended at about 6am. We wonder why security did not make floor rounds after these party-goers disperse to their rooms after 1am. Walking the halls periodically during the night would have detected the issues that were happening all night on multiple floors. We know that other guests had a rough night because we were able to share stories at around 7:45 am when we were evacuated from our rooms (some of us roused from the shower) by the hotel and fire department. Apparently it was someone's idea of a joke. Of course the hotel manager could not adjust our bill more than $50.00. Nothing could compensate us for how totally exhausted we are. If anyone is masochistic enough to stay here do note that if you call down to the restaurant and are told they can't seat you because they are fully reserved - walk down anyway - you will find that they can seat you and you will find that 30 percent of the tables will be empty throughout your dinner.
reviews.title: Brutal experience; absolutely worst hotel experience.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is billed as eco-friendly.
reviews.title: my worst hotel experience ...

reviews.text: The room was ok - tiny but ok.
reviews.title: Good location, average stay

reviews.text: The hotel is in the middle of nowhere.
reviews.title: Euro-trendy hotel in superb location
Be careful if you are a business traveler!!
reviews.text: They will provide you a copy of the bill with your hotel room and tax. Then they will charge your credit card $4.00 for a bottled water separately thinking you won't notice the separate charge since it is a business account. The "restaurant" downstairs for hotel guests is designed more as a bar for the general public. It is VERY noisy and it is very difficult to get service unless you are buying cocktails! For breakfast, you buy it at a snack bar downstairs..no service is provided.

Stay in Boston. That sums it up. I was traveling on business and needed to check in early because I had an early meeting. The clerk said there were no rooms. I could accept that - it happens - except that no less than 10 people checked out in the 10 minutes I was standing there. I had just flown across country and yes, I should have thought to book the room for the night before, but they were no help. I was willing to pay extra to check in early, even an extra day's stay, but was told the housekeeping staff could not get a room cleaned in less than 5 hours. The man in front of me had just finished yelling at the front desk staff, so I'm pretty sure my case was not an isolated incident of just UNhelpfulness. I could go on but take my advice and stay in Boston and take a cab to wherever you need to be in Newton. I would never stay here again.
reviews.title: Worst * Customer * Service * Ever

reviews.text: Great business-hotel in Newton close to Riverside Station.
reviews.title: Nice hotel outside Boston (25 minutes by train).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff/front desk is friendly, rooms are nice and the restaurant / bar in the basement is great! Make sure you visit BOX109 (the restaurant / bar).
reviews.title: Great location- good hotel it you get a good rate!

reviews.text: The hotel is a little too close to I-95, but make sure to get a room away from the highway, if you are a light sleeper.
reviews.title: great location, disappointed in condition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some of the previous negative reviews, I was a bit apprehensive about this hotel.
reviews.title: Excellent boutique hotel, would stay again

reviews.text: Happily, my fears were not met.
reviews.title: Very average

reviews.text: This is an excellent boutique hotel with many upgrades from the comfortable bed to the upscale bathroom - Aveda products, huge shower, Toto toilet, plush towels and very clean. Hot water came almost instantly. Iron and ironing board in closet. Small safe. No refrigerator. Most light switches are also dimmer switches. Requested a quiet room and got it. Staff friendly and helpful. Easy to find, take Grove Street exit (Exit 22) from I-95. Parking was $7.
reviews.title: Awesome location and value for a modern and trendy hotel stay.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative was that the heater was a bit loud, but the hotel is located in a very quiet area.
reviews.title: Misunderstanding made worse by lack of customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There's a limited Continental breakfast downstairs (not free). Free Wall Street Journal and USA Today. Very nice bar and restaurant area downstairs which I didn't have a chance to use.
reviews.title: Very Good Value

description: Escape the hectic pace of the city yet be close enough to easily visit at this contemporary boutique hotel adjacent to Boston train station and offering complimentary WiFi, 24 hour business center and state-of-the-art fitness center. Inside is the highly acclaimed BOKX 109 American Prime, a modern steakhouse for drinks and dinner and Phi Cafe featuring Starbuck's coffee, light breakfast and lunch fare.
